summary: Fix favicon not displaying in now-live Version 55 by regenerating a favicon set using the pink heart on a white circular background at standard sizes, replacing all existing favicon assets, and updating `frontend/index.html` `<link>` tags/filenames so the referenced files exist under `/assets/generated/` (or `frontend/public/assets/generated/`) and browsers can load them.
architectural_notes: Favicon integration depends on generated favicon image files being present in the project (expected under `/assets/generated/`) to match the `<link>` tags in `frontend/index.html`. Regenerate and add missing favicon assets so browsers can load them.
Decision: Use the pink heart on a white circular background for favicon assets going forward; replace all existing favicon assets and update HTML filenames/paths to match the regenerated set.
Deployment decision: Version 55 has been released to production (replacing Version 54).
known_issues: Favicon not displaying because referenced favicon image files are missing from the project (no generated favicon assets found in expected locations such as `/assets/generated/`).
After releasing Version 55, the favicon still may not appear until the regenerated favicon assets (heart on white circle) are present and `frontend/index.html` references are updated to match.
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Centered pink heart on a solid white circular background (favicon-16.dim_16x16.png, 16x16)
- Centered pink heart on a solid white circular background (favicon-32.dim_32x32.png, 32x32)
- Centered pink heart on a solid white circular background (apple-touch-icon.dim_180x180.png, 180x180)
- Centered pink heart on a solid white circular background (android-chrome-192.dim_192x192.png, 192x192)
- Centered pink heart on a solid white circular background (android-chrome-512.dim_512x512.png, 512x512)

existing_features.title: Generate favicon image assets that visually match the app’s existing heart icon style: a centered pink heart on a white circular background.
Wire the new favicon assets into the app HTML so browsers pick them up (standard favicon + Apple touch icon). Update frontend/index.html head to include the correct <link> tags.
Publish Draft Version 50 as the live version of the dapp/tab (i.e., promote Draft Version 50 to the currently live version).

Generate a completely new favicon image set consisting of a very simple pink heart on a transparent background, exported at the standard favicon sizes used by the app, and add the resulting files to `frontend/public/assets/generated/` using the exact filenames referenced by `frontend/index.html`.

Regenerate a complete favicon image set that matches the app’s chosen style: a centered pink heart on a solid white circular background, exported as PNGs in all sizes referenced by `frontend/index.html`, and add them to `frontend/public/assets/generated/` using the exact filenames referenced by the HTML.

Update the favicon generation utility (`frontend/src/lib/generate-favicons.ts`) so that its output matches the selected style (pink heart on a white circular background) and remains aligned with the favicon sizes/filenames used by `frontend/index.html`.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create a dapp favicon using the existing front-page heart icon (pink heart) on a white circular background.
Add the missing favicon image files referenced by frontend/index.html under frontend/public/assets/generated so the browser can load and display the favicon.
Ensure the generated favicon images visually match the app’s existing heart icon style (a centered pink heart on a white circular background) across all required favicon sizes.
Add the missing favicon image files under `frontend/public/assets/generated/` using the exact filenames referenced by `frontend/index.html` so the browser can successfully load them at runtime.

Verify that `frontend/index.html` favicon `<link>` tags resolve to the generated assets and keep the filenames/paths aligned with the assets in `frontend/public/assets/generated/` (update the HTML only if needed to match the generated filenames).
Add the missing favicon image files to `frontend/public/assets/generated/` using the exact filenames referenced by `frontend/index.html` so the browser can successfully load them at runtime.

Verify that `frontend/index.html` favicon `<link>` tags match the generated asset filenames and paths under `/assets/generated/`, and update `frontend/index.html` only if needed to keep the HTML references aligned with the actual files.

Regenerate favicon assets using a pink heart on a white circular background, replace all existing favicon assets, and update `frontend/index.html` to reference the new filenames/paths so the favicon displays correctly.

Update `frontend/index.html` favicon `<link>` tags to fully match the regenerated favicon set (paths, filenames, and sizes), replacing any existing favicon link tags so browsers load the new assets correctly.

projectName: Fix favicon assets + update HTML (pink heart on white circle)
